pr_title: [DOCS] Add xref to multiplexer token filter docs

timeline.bodyText: This is not a typo, but refers to shingle token filters. Since this has confused you, maybe its not clear enough. What could we do to make it easier to understand?
timeline.author: cbuescher
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@ filters:: a list of token filters to apply to incoming tokens.  These can be any
   using a comma-delimited string, so for example `"lowercase, porter_stem"` would
   apply the `lowercase` filter and then the `porter_stem` filter to a single token.
 
-WARNING: Shingle or multi-word synonym token filters will not function normally
+WARNING: Single or multi-word synonym token filters will not function normally

replies.bodyText:
Oh! my false, I'm new to elasticsearch and this word is not familiar to me.
btw, The docs itself is perfectly understandable, but it's would be great to add a hyperlink to refers "shingle token filters" in this context. it might prevent misunderstanding for new coming like me.
Thanks.
replies.author: paiboon15721

replies.bodyText: Great, since you already opened the PR, maybe you'd be interested in making that change and pushing it as an update to this PR? Otherwise we can just close it.
replies.author: cbuescher

timeline.message: [DOCS] Add hyperlink ref to Shingle token filter in Multiplexer token filter docs (#60431)
[DOCS] Add hyperlink ref to Shingle token filter in Multiplexer token filter docs (#60431)
